Text1: The document-handling system (TIU) shall have boilerplate and cut and paste capabilities.

Text1: The system shall wait until the user explicitly selects an item using the mouse or the keyboard if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.
Text2: The system shall allow the creation ofpatient lists or team lists that simplify tasks such as reviewing patient charts, ordering, and signing orders and notes and theselists can be based on wards, clinics, teams, or other groups.

Text1: The system shall select the item at the top of the list if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.

Text1: The system shall select the item at the top of the list if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.
Text2: The system shall indicate that the record is sensitive and may only be viewed by authorized users.

Text2: The system shall display a message telling the user that the selected patient is deceased.

Text1: The system shall select the item at the top of the list if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.

Text1: The system shall select the item at the top of the list if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.
Text2: The system shall improve accessibility of online clinical information and results.

Text1: The system shall select the item at the top of the list if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.
Text2: The system shall provide background checks on duplicate orders, drug-drug interactions, and many other criteria that a user can choose.

Text1: The system shall select the item at the top of the list if the user does not enter enough characters to uniquely identify an item.
Text2: The system shall integrate orders with progress notes, results, procedures, diagnosis, and Problem List.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
Text2: The system shall support the Ambulatory Care Date Capture project for capturing encounter data for workload credit, as well as capturing clinically relevant data for reminders and reports.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
Text2: The system shall include clinical reminders to provide relevant information to providers, at the point of care, for improving patient care.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
Text2: The system shall include a graphing feature to allow users to view lab test results and vital signs in a graph.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
Text2: The system shall include a report construction feature so each site can individually run related to patient data including: Health Summary, Vitals Cumulative, Nutritional Assessment, Daily Order Summary and Order Summary for a Date Range reports.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
Text2: The system shall support requirements for codified data, including diagnosis data using ICD-9 codes.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
Text2: The system shall have the capability to capture and store risk, social and medical factors; including, but not limited to the following: Tobacco use and history including number of years and packs per day (PPD), Alcohol use history, Drug use history, Occupational environment, Marital status, Occupation, Religious preference, Ethnicity, Healthcare surrogate with alert, Guardian/legal representative with alert.

Text1: The system shall allow user classes to be used across VistA to replace and/or complement security keys.
